scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying there’s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. Your colleague, Mark, messages: 'Hey Alex, I really need your help with this urgent task. Can you help me out?' You responded, 'Mark, I'm currently on leave. Can you ask someone else, or can it wait until I return?'
scenes.description: Mark replies, 'I understand you're off, but there's really no one else who can handle this as well as you. It's quite critical.'

options.text: Let me see what I can do. Send me the details and I'll take a quick look.
options.analysis: You showed high empathy and emotional perception by agreeing to help despite your leave, but your self-regulation could be improved as you interrupted your time off.

options.text: Mark, I'm really on leave for a reason. Please find someone else to handle this.
options.analysis: You maintained good self-regulation by setting boundaries, but showed less empathy and motivation towards the urgent task.

options.text: I understand the urgency. I'll help this time, but please ensure there’s a backup plan for such situations in the future.
options.analysis: You balanced empathy and self-regulation well, and communicated your availability clearly, showing good social skills.
